item.title: An Unexpected Hanging
item.description: I came across a very intriguing paradox in a Martin Gardner book, titled An Unexpected Hanging And Other Mathemaical Diversions. I was very interested in how deeply the paradox divides logic from reality and in how many ways it can be portrayed. It appeared in the 1940’s and was discussed by Professor Michael Scriven in 1951. The Story The story of the paradox goes like this. A prisoner is sentenced by a judge to be hanged on Saturday.

item.title: Mysterious Benedict Society
item.description: The Mysterious Benedict Society The Mysterious Benedict Society is a book series for children 10 and up, and is written but Trenton Lee Stewart. item.title: Hello World
item.description: Hi, I’m AJ! This is my first blog post to check if my setup is okay. I hope to write about some of my projects and interests. Tennis - I am a nationally ranked USTA tennis player and I have played for many years. Books - My favorite genres of books is fantasy and history. History - Reading and analyzing history, especially the history of Egypt and Rome, is one of my favorite things to do and I feel like history is just one big mystery to unravel.
